title: Cyril Ramaphosa
summary: Matamela Cyril Ramaphosa (born 17 November 1952) is a South African businessman and politician who, since 2018, serves as the fifth president of South Africa and president of the African National Congress (ANC) since 2017. Previously an anti-apartheid activist, trade union leader and businessman, Ramaphosa served as secretary general to ANC President Nelson Mandela, deputy president to President Jacob Zuma, and chairman of the National Planning Commission[2] from 2014 to 2018.
